name: Prostate Path Extension
title: Prostate Pathological Extension
notes:
**Note 1:** Only use histologic information from prostatectomy, including simple prostatectomy with negative margins, and autopsy in this field.  Information from biopsy of extraprostatic sites is coded in EOD Primary Tumor.

**Note 2:** Code 900 if there is no prostatectomy performed within the first course of treatment.

**Note 3:** Limit information in this field to first course of treatment in the absence of disease progression. 

**Note 4:** When prostate cancer is an incidental finding during a prostatectomy for other reasons (for example, a cystoprostatectomy for bladder cancer), use the appropriate code for the extent of disease found. 

**Note 5:** Involvement of the prostatic urethra does not alter the extension code. 

**Note 6:** "Frozen pelvis" is a clinical term which means tumor extends to pelvic sidewall(s).  In the absence of a more detailed statement of involvement, assign this to code 700.
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 3-30

(5) Buyyounouski, M.K., Lin, D.W., et al. **Prostate**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 715-726

Intracapsular involvement only
No extracapsular extension

Confined to prostate, NOS 
Localized, NOS

Bladder neck, microscopic invasion

Extraprostatic extension (beyond prostatic capsule), unilateral, bilateral, or NOS
WITHOUT invasion of the seminal vesicles

Extension to periprostatic tissue WITHOUT invasion of the seminal vesicles

Extraprostatic tumor that is not fixed 
WITHOUT invasion of adjacent structures

Periprostatic extension, NOS (unknown if seminal vesicle(s) involved)

Extraprostatic extension, NOS (unknown if seminal vesicle(s) involved)

Through capsule, NOS

Bladder neck, except microscopic bladder neck involvement 
Bladder, NOS
External sphincter
Extraprostatic urethra (membranous urethra)
Fixation, NOS
Levator muscles
Rectovesical (Denonvillier's) fascia
Rectum
Skeletal muscle
Ureter(s)

Extension to or fixation to pelvic wall or pelvic bone
"Frozen pelvis", NOS 

Further contiguous extension including
- Bone
- Other organs
- Penis
- Sigmoid colon
- Soft tissue other than periprostatic

Prostatectomy performed, but not first course of treatment 
for example performed after disease progression

Unknown if prostatectomy done
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
